items.title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
items.description: The Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) sold equities worth Rs 476  crore on May 13, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) extended their buying on third day as they bought equities of Rs 4,273 crore on the same day.

items.description: Cipla also allayed concerns that the US government's drug pricing executive order on pharma companies, aimed at lowering cost of prescription medicines, will not impact Indian generic players.

items.description: Tata Steel is now focusing on capital allocation. It is undertaking capex, based on the merits of the business and the regions concerned

items.description: Shares of Mazagon Dock are up 23 percent in the last 30 days, while Paras Defence and Data Patterns have rallied up to 47 percent in this period.

items.title: Sensex, Nifty trade marginally higher; IT, metal stocks rally, banks drag; India VIX eases 5%
items.description: The broader market outpaced the frontline indices as the Nifty Smallcap 100 (1.26 percent), while the Nifty Midcap 100 gained 0.96 percent trend is likely to persist as the earnings season, largely in line with expectations, draws to a close.

items.title: With Nifty above 200-DMA, momentum and sentiment backs near-term bullish calls
items.description: While the Nifty 50 has been trading above 200-DMA for a few days, this is the first time since January that the index crossed and stayed consistently above the mark.

items.title: Bank Nifty plunges 550 pts from day's high; AU SFB, Kotak Mahindra Bank among top losers: What lies ahead?
items.description: Among top losers of the index are AU Small Finance Bank, which fell 1.44% while Kotak Mahindra Bank fell 1%.

items.title: Small, midcap indices outperform benchmarks to extend gains for a third session: These are the top gainers
items.description: Easing tensions between India and Pakistan have significantly boosted share prices this week, supported by a thaw in trade war between US and China.

items.title: Buy HDFC Bank; target of Rs 2192: Geojit Financial Services
items.description: Geojit Financial Services is bullish on HDFC Bank has recommended buy rating on the stock with a target price of Rs 2192 in its research report dated May 06, 2025.

items.title: IndusInd Bank's former top bosses may face board penalty for insider trading: Sources
items.description: If the bank’s board imposes a penalty for violation of its insider trading policy, then the market regulator SEBI may also proceed against the two bankers.

items.title: Solar stocks shine as analysts see real export potential alongside strong domestic growth
items.description: Industry experts said emerging opportunities for Indian exporters after the UK FTA, along with a growing domestic demand could ensure continued momentum in shares of renewable sector companies, despite elevated valuations.

items.title: GE Vernova T&D shares rise on Rs 140 crore investment from NYSE-listed parent for electrical equipment capex
items.description: The investment plan includes development of a new manufacturing line at the existing Chennai facility, along with a new Noida facility that will be operational by the end of 2025. The manufacturing line at the Chennai facility will be ready by early 2027, the company said.

items.title: The quick commerce conundrum
items.description: The quick commerce boom is turning into a brutal endurance test, where rising losses clash with investor optimism.

items.title: Q4 result impact: Dalmia Bharat Sugar shares up 9% as PAT more than doubles, GSK Pharma and AB Capital shares rise 5%
items.description: Q4 result impact | GSK Pharma reported a 35% rise in net profit to Rs 263 crore in Q4 FY25, while Aditya Birla Capital reported a net profit of Rs 864.60 crore for the fourth quarter, lower by nearly 31 percent on year.

items.title: Garden Reach shares soar 18%, touch 10-month high as profit doubles in Q4
items.description: Garden Reach revenue from operations climbed by 61.7 percent year-on-year (YoY) to Rs 1,642 crore in Q4FY25

items.title: Live: Sensex, Nifty resume rally but trim gains from day's highs | Closing Bell
items.description: Markets closed off the day's highs in a choppy session. The Sensex slipped nearly 500 points from its intraday high, while the Nifty shed around 100 points. Despite the volatility, broader markets outperformed the benchmarks. Metal stocks rallied on cooling inflation data, while Financials and FMCG stocks dragged indices lower. The advance-decline ratio stood strong at 2:1. India VIX continued to ease, down 5%. Catch Lovisha Darad and Yatin Mota as they discuss stocks on their radar.

items.title: Top gainers and losers today: Stocks that moved the most on May 14
items.description: Broader markets outperformed the benchmarks, with smallcap and midcap indices jumping over 1 percent each.

items.title: Taking Stock: Sensex gains 182 pts, Nifty above 24,650; mid, smallcaps outperform
items.description: Broader indices outperformed the main indices with BSE Midcap index rising 1 percent and Smallcap index 1.6 percent.

items.title: FIIs net buy Rs 931 crore in equities; DIIs pump Rs 316 crore on May 14
items.description: For the year so far, FIIs have been net sellers of shares worth Rs 1.24 lakh crore, while DIIs have net bought Rs 2.27 lakh crore worth of shares.
